message: I'm excited to offer you a great deal on this product! It's a fantastic opportunity to get a unique item at a steal. I'm confident you'll love it, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. What do you say? Will you take it off my hands?
I'm not sure about the product, can you tell me a bit more about it before I make a decision?

I understand your hesitation! This product is a one-of-a-kind item that's hard to find elsewhere. I've had great feedback from other customers who've purchased similar products, and I'm confident it'll meet your expectations. Plus, the price is unbeatable at $100. If you're still unsure, I can offer to throw in a free accessory that'll enhance the product's functionality. What do you think?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not convinced. Can you tell me more about the product's features and how it compares to other similar products on the market?

I understand your concerns, and I'm happy to provide more details! This product is a top-of-the-line item that stands out from the competition. Its unique feature is its ability to [insert impressive feature here], which sets it apart from other products in the market. In fact, many of our customers have reported significant improvements in [specific area] after using this product. I'm confident that you'll be thrilled with its performance. And, as before, I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. What do you think?
I appreciate the additional information, but I'm still hesitant. Can you tell me what the return policy is if I decide to return the product after purchasing it?

I understand your concerns, and I want to be upfront with you - our return policy is very straightforward. Unfortunately, all sales are final, and we don't offer refunds or exchanges. However, I'm confident that you'll love the product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. I'm willing to take a risk on you, and I think you'll be happy with your purchase. Plus, think of all the money you'll save by getting this product at this price! What do you say?
I understand the return policy, but I'm still not willing to take the risk. I'd rather not purchase the product at this time.

I understand your hesitation, but I want to make you a special offer. I've been struggling to move this product, and I'm willing to let it go for $90. That's right, I'm dropping the price by $10 just for you. This is a one-time offer, and I won't be able to match this price again. If you're still unsure, I can throw in an additional free accessory that'll make the product even more valuable. What do you say?
I appreciate the discounted price, but I'm still not convinced. I'm not sure if the additional accessory would make up for the potential value of the product.

I understand your concerns, and I'm willing to make another concession. I'll throw in not one, not two, but three additional accessories with the purchase of this product. That's a total of $30 in value, absolutely free. And, I'll still sell it to you for $90. That's a total of $130 in value for just $90. I'm willing to take a big risk to get this product off my hands. What do you say? Is this a deal you can't refuse?

I appreciate the extra accessories, but I'm still not willing to take the risk. The potential value of the product is still unknown to me, and I don't want to overpay for something that might be worthless.

I understand your concerns, and I want to assure you that this product is a real game-changer. I've had the pleasure of using it myself, and I can confidently say that it's one of the best products I've ever come across. It's a limited edition item, and I'm only offering it to you because I know you're a savvy buyer who appreciates value. I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, and I'm willing to give you a 30-day money-back guarantee. If you're not completely satisfied with the product, I'll give you a full refund. What do you say? Is this a risk you're willing to take?

I appreciate the guarantee, but I'm still not convinced. The fact that you've used it yourself doesn't necessarily mean it's good, and I'm not willing to take the risk of buying a potentially worthless product.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your caution. I want to be upfront with you - this product isn't for everyone. But I believe it has the potential to be a great value for the right person. I'm willing to sell it to you for $80, and I'll throw in a personalized guarantee. If you're not happy with the product, I'll not only give you a full refund, but I'll also give you a $20 credit towards your next purchase. That's a total of $100 in value for just $80. What do you say? Is this a risk you're willing to take?

I'll take the product for $80, but I want to make it clear that I'm only doing this because of the personalized guarantee. I'm not convinced it's worth more than $80 to me, but I'm willing to take the risk.

Congratulations on your purchase! I'm glad you took the risk and gave our product a try. Now, I'd like to offer you an exclusive deal on our next product. This one is even better than the last, and I think you'll love it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $120, but I'll give you a special discount of 10% off just because you're a valued customer. That brings the price down to $108. Plus, I'll throw in a free upgrade to our premium service, which includes priority support and a 60-day money-back guarantee. What do you say? Is this a deal you'd be interested in?

I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying another product from you after the last one turned out to be low-quality. I'm not willing to take another risk on a product without knowing its quality.

I understand your concerns, and I apologize again for the previous product not meeting your expectations. I want to assure you that this product is different. It's a completely new item, and I've taken extra care to ensure its quality. I'm willing to offer you an even better deal than before - I'll sell it to you for $70, and I'll throw in a personalized note of apology and a guarantee that if you're not satisfied, I'll give you a full refund and a $20 credit towards your next purchase. What do you say? Is this a chance for me to make it right?

I'll take the product for $70, but I want to make it clear that I'm only doing this because of the personalized guarantee and the apology. I'm not convinced it's worth more than $70 to me, but I'm willing to take the risk.

Congratulations on your second purchase! I'm glad I could make it right with you. Now, I want to be upfront with you - this next product is not one of our best. I appreciate the honesty, but I'm not interested in buying another low-quality product. I'm starting to think that your products are not worth the risk, and I'd rather not take another chance on something that might be worthless to me.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your decision. I want to apologize again for the previous mistakes. I'm willing to make one more offer, and I'm willing to go all out to make it right.
